name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: [SOUND] This lecture is a continued discussion

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: of evaluation of text categorization.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Earlier we have introduced measures that can be used with computer provision and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: recall.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: For each category and each document now in this lecture we're going to

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: further examine how to combine the performance of the different categories of

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _different documents how to aggregate them

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: You see on the title here I indicated it's called a macro average and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: this is in contrast to micro average that we'll talk more about later.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So
column7: for each category we're going to compute the precision require an f1 so _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _for example category c1 we have precision p1
column6: recall r1 and F value f1. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And similarly we can do that for category 2 and and all the other categories.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Now once we compute that and we can aggregate them

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: example we can aggregate all the precision values.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _For all the categories

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And this is often very useful to summarize what we have seen in the whole data set.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And aggregation can be done many different ways.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Again as I said
column6: in a case when you need to aggregate different values

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: it's always good to think about what's the best way of doing the aggregation.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _For example

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _you can use geometric mean

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Depending on the way you aggregate
column6: you might have got different conclusions. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _in terms of which method works better
column6: so it's important to consider these _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: differences and choosing the right one or a more suitable one for your task.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So the difference fore example between arithmetically and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: geometrically is that the arithmetically would be dominated by high

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: values whereas geometrically would be more affected by low values.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Base and so whether you are want to emphasis low values or

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: high values would be a question relate with all you And

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: similar we can do that for recal and F score.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So that's how we can generate the overall precision

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Now we can do the same for aggregation of other all the document All right.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So it's exactly the same situation for each document on our computer.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Precision

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _And then after we have completed the computation for all these documents

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _we're going to aggregate them to generate the overall precision

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: overall F score.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _These are
column7: examining the results from different angles. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Which one's more useful will depend on your application.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _In general
column6: it's beneficial to look at the results from all these perspectives. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _And especially if you compare different methods in different dimensions

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: it might reveal which method Is better in which measure or

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: in what situations and this provides insightful.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Understanding the strands of a method or a weakness and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: this provides further insight for improving them.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So as I mentioned

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: in contrast to the macro average that we talked about earlier.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _In this case
column6: what we do is you pool together all the decisions

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and then compute the precision and recall.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So we can compute the overall precision and recall by just counting

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _how many cases are in true positive
column6: how many cases in false positive

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _etc
column6: it's computing the values in the contingency table

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and then we can compute the precision and recall just once.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _In contrast
column7: we're going to do that for each category first. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And then aggregate over these categories or we do that for each document and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: then aggregate all the documents but here we pooled them together.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Now this would be very similar to the classification accuracy that we

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _used earlier

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _one problem here of course to treat all the instances

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And this may not be desirable.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _But it may be a property for some applications

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _especially if we associate the

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Then we can actually compute for example

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Where you associate the different cost or utility for each specific decision

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: so there could be variations of these methods that would be more useful.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _But in general macro average tends to be more information than micro average

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: just because it might reflect the need for understanding performance

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: on each category or performance on each document which are needed in applications.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _But macro averaging and micro averaging

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and you might see both reported in research papers on Categorization.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Also sometimes categorization results might actually

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: be evaluated from ranking prospective.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And this is because categorization results are sometimes or

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: often indeed passed it to a human for various purposes.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: it might be passed to humans for further editing. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _For example
column6: news articles can be tempted to be categorized by using a system and _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: then human editors would then correct them.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And all the email messages might be throughout to the right person for

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: handling in the help desk.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And in such a case the categorizations will help prioritizing

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: the task for particular customer service person.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So
column6: in this case the results have to be prioritized _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and if the system can't give a score to the categorization decision for

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: confidence then we can use the scores to rank these decisions and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _then evaluate the results as a rank list
column6: just as in a search engine. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Evaluation where you rank the documents in responsible query.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So for example a discovery of spam emails can be evaluated

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: based on ranking emails for the spam category.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And this is useful if you want people to to verify whether this is really

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _spam

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: The person would then take the rank To check one by one and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: then verify whether this is indeed a spam.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So to reflect the utility for humans in such a task

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: better to evaluate Ranking Chris and this is basically similar to a search again.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And in such a case often the problem can be

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: better formulated as a ranking problem instead of a categorization problem.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So for example
column6: ranking documents in a search engine can also be framed _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _as a binary categorization problem

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _are useful to users from those that are not useful

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _frame this as a ranking problem
column6: and we evaluate it as a rank list. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: That's because people tend to examine the results so

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: ranking evaluation more reflects utility from user's perspective.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _So to summarize categorization evaluation

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: first evaluation is always very important for all these tasks.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So get it right.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _If you don't get it right

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _And you might be misled to believe one method is better than the other

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: which is in fact not true.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So it's very important to get it right.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Measures must also reflect the intended use of the results for

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: a particular application.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _For example

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: news categorization the results are used in maybe different ways.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So then we would need to consider the difference and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: design measures appropriately.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: We generally need to consider how will the results be further processed by the user

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and think from a user's perspective.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: What quality is important?

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: What aspect of quality is important?

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Sometimes there are trade offs between multiple aspects like precision and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _recall and so we need to know for this application is high recall more important

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: or high precision is more important.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Ideally we associate the different cost with each different decision arrow.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: And this of course has to be designed in an application specific way.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Some commonly used measures for relative comparison methods are the following.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _Classification accuracy
column6: it's very commonly used for especially balance. _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: [INAUDIBLE] preceding [INAUDIBLE] Scores are common and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _report characterizing performances
column6: given angles and give us some _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: [INAUDIBLE] like a [INAUDIBLE] Per document basis [INAUDIBLE] And then

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _take a average of all of them

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: _In general
column6: you want to look at the results from multiple perspectives and for _

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: particular applications some perspectives would be more important than others but

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: diagnoses and analysis of categorization methods.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: It's generally useful to look at as many perspectives as possible

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: to see subtle differences between methods or tow see where a method might be weak

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: from which you can obtain sight for improving a method.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: Finally sometimes ranking may be more appropriate so

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: be careful sometimes categorization has got may be better frame as a ranking tasks

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: and there're machine running methods for optimizing ranking measures as well.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: So here are two suggested readings.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: One is some chapters of this book where you can find more discussion about

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: evaluation measures.

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: The second is a paper about comparison of different approaches to

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: text categorization and

name: 4 - 13 - 3.13 Text Categorization- Evaluation Part 2 (00-10-51).srt
text: it also has an excellent discussion of how to evaluate textual categorization.
